snippet: When Ellen Barry went on vacation in Mongolia with her family, she saw their teenage guide turn into a spirit. And that's not all. There were hearty meals, Bactrian camels and baleful signs of iron dzuds and black dzuds. "We caught glimpses of an...
abstract: When Ellen Barry went on vacation in Mongolia with her family, she saw their teenage guide turn into a spirit. And that's not all. There were hearty meals, Bactrian camels and baleful signs of iron dzuds and black dzuds. "We caught glimpses of an ancient people," she writes, "remnants of a culture that by all rights should have vanished along with most of the earth's wild places."

headline.main: As Mongolia Changes, the Past Is Still Present
